result.execSummary:
The defendant Shrina K. Smith was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Conditions:  

Attend, pay for, and successfully complete any educational programs or counseling as ordered by the agent.

Pay costs of supervision.

Defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  Defendant to follow up with the Clerk of Court regarding that procedure when the time comes.  

Court did not impose a DNA surcharge in this case but did direct defendant to submit to DNA sampling at the Richland County Sheriff's Department before signing up for probation.

Court has waived all court costs in this case.
Concurrent with: 13CM166

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shrina K. Smith

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Warrant cancellation by DA (note; warrants taken out of system on 01/06/16 at sentencing)

3 cases called together:  13CM166, 14CF19, and 13CF80.  Defendant Shrina K. Smith in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Jennifer M. Harper appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Counsel inform the court that the parties have an agreement on resolution whereby def will plead as charged in 13CM166, will plead to amended charge (mis. theft) in 14CF19, and will plead to amended charge (mis. theft) in 13CF80.  Court allows the amendments.  Def pleads guilty to the charges including those as amended.  Court's colloquy on pleas.  Finding of guilty.  Atty. M asks for one set of court costs between the three cases with costs as a condition of probation.  Jt recommendation calls for probation of 24 months with assessments and treatment at the direction of the agent.  Sentence:  withheld for 24 months probation.  Conditions:  attend, pay for, and succ. complete any educational programs or counseling as ordered by agent; pay one set of costs; defendant to be eligible for expungement per 973.015 upon successful completion of probation.  Warrants vacated.  No DNA surcharges imposed.
email request from Atty. McDougal to schedule this case for plea/sentencing on 12/2 at 1:30 - case presently in warrant status
